skills.skill: ACLS, PALS, BLS, and ATLS Certifications

duties_responsibilities.duty: Administer and maintain a positive educational environment for residents and faculty of the Emergency Medicine Residency
Ensure the quality of didactic and clinical education meet Accreditation Counsel of Graduate Medical Education (ACGME) emergency medicine residency requirements
Assure compliance with all ACGME and Emergency Medicine Residency Review Committee requirements
Provide residents with required semi-annual evaluation and real-time feedback on academic and clinical performance
Participate in educational initiatives for medical students as opportunities arise
Maintain clinical competence in independent practice of emergency medicine and while supervising emergency medicine residents, other rotating residents, and medical students
Serve as a member of the Clinical Competency Committee and Program Evaluation Committee
Serve as a role model to residents and medical students as an emergency medicine physician with excellent clinical skills
Maintain board certification in emergency medicine with continuing certification requirements for maintenance of certification
Develop a career focus in scholarly activity and develop a portfolio of publications, presentations, and academic focus reportable yearly
Attend emergency medicine residency conferences and serve as a proctor/instructor when assigned by residency leadership
Attend faculty development activities as recommended by the Emergency Medicine Residency Program Director, Designated Institutional Official (DIO), or Department Chair
Complete special projects and perform other duties as assigned

education_certification.credential: MD or DO degree with American Board of Emergency Medicine (ABEM or ABOEM) board certification in Emergency Medicine
